opinion_refused_hajj: Refused to go on Hajj with me
EVTDESC86000: You have started to prepare yourself for going on a pilgrimage to Mecca. Soon you will humble yourself and travel in a group with others to fulfill one of the five pillars of Islam.
EVTOPTA86000: All are equal in front of God!
EVTDESC86001: I am preparing myself for my travel to Mecca, and I have understood that there are members of my court that have not yet gone on a pilgrimage to Mecca. As [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], it is my duty to be charitable to my people, and I will bring one of them with me.
EVTOPTA86001: It will make travel more enjoyable...
EVTDESC86010: While preparing for my pilgrimage to Mecca, I have come to realize that [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] is not a Hajjaj.
EVTOPTB86010: Clearly, he is a busy man...
EVTDESC86011: My beloved [Root.GetTitle]!\n I am preparing to go to Mecca on a Hajj. Sadly, rumors tell me that you have not gone on a pilgrimage yourself. Would you like to travel with me, your faithful servant?\nYour humble [From.GetTitledName]
EVTTOOLTIP86012: will be travelling together with us...
EVTDESC86012: Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!\nI will join you on your way to Mecca!\nYour liege, [From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC86013: I am sincerely regretful to inform you that I am not able to join you in your pilgrimage.\n[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC86015: Our liege, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName], has heard of our plans to go to Mecca, and sends us advice that the road is perilous with infidels and bandits.
EVTDESC86020: While preparing for my pilgrimage to Mecca, my son comes to me and asks if he can join me.
EVTDESC86100: I am now fully prepared for my travel to Mecca! There will be a regent ruling [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] while I am away.
EVTDESC86101: A group of bandits are tracking us, and it seems as if they are gaining on us.
EVTOPTB86101: Its our duty to stop them..
EVTTOOLTIP86102: Me and my group of pilgrims will engage the bandits.
EVTDESC86102: It is not possible to outrun these bandits, and we are forced to confront them. There is always the possibility that we can survive this.
EVTOPTA86102: They are few enough to defeat alone..
EVTOPTC86102: Pay them with our remaining gold.
EVTDESC86105: Travelling by sea causes you to feel seasick. Luckily there is a hafiz on the ship who quotes the holy Qur'an. 'And they shall be made to drink therein a cup the admixture of which shall be ginger'.
EVTDESC86110: As you travel over the sea, your ship spots the sails of a well-known Christian pirate. We have a faster ship, and the chance to eliminate this threat to pilgrims forever!
EVTOPTA86110: It's too great of a risk...
EVTDESC86150: Nearby you see how a group of bandits have encircled a group of fellow pilgrims. It is very likely they will rob and kill them.
EVTOPTA86150: There is nothing we can do...
EVTDESC86151: We got surrounded by bandits, and I was sure that I was soon going to be robbed and left for dead, when some fellow pilgrims arrived to save us.
EVTDESC86160: One of my servants have noticed that a hated rival is camping not far from us. I know that it is against the teachings of the prophet to attack someone on Hajj, but this is a golden opportunity.
EVTOPTA86160: Attempt to ambush him in the night..
EVTDESC86161: We have been ambushed, and it seems as if it is [From.GetTitledName] who is attempting to kill you. It is an outrage, and it clear that he is not a proper Muslim to attempt such a vile act in the darkness!
EVTTOOLTIP86162: is left for dead in the night..
EVTOPTC86161: We got enough time to run away..
EVTDESC86162: Our ambush ended in disaster... Not only did [From.GetTitledName] get away, but he also injured me severely.
EVTDESC86163: Success!\nI've left [From.GetTitledName], bleeding severely, to die in the desert...
EVTOPTA86163: He will surely die soon enough..
EVTDESC86164: It seems that [From.GetTitledName] got away in the quiet of the night...
EVTDESC86165: A messenger comes with an invitation from [From.GetTitledName] who is camped not far from us, offering to break bread and reconcile our differences.
EVTOPTA86165: We are brothers in the faith after all..
EVTDESC86166: [From.GetTitledName] has joined our camp and we are breaking bread together, reconciling our differences.
EVTDESC86167:
Honorable [Root.GetTitledName]!
I regret to inform you that I will not be able to break bread with you today, as I need to break camp immediately.

[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC86170: Travelling to Mecca gives time for reflection. A man should not go into excess when it comes to food, and should always abstain from wine!
EVTOPTA86170: I shall be more moderate in my eating..
EVTDESC86180: It seems as if we have managed to get lost here in the desert. One of the humble servants seems as if he might know the right way.
EVTOPTA86180: I am [Root.GetTitle]! I know the best way!
EVTDESC86300: As you stop for camp one evening, you notice that an old man in poor clothing has made camp at the same place. The man offers to tell you a hadith he has if you can spare him some bread.
EVTOPTB86300: It is just an old man...
TOOLTIP_LISTEN_TO_HADITH: You listen carefully to the old man's hadith.\n
EVTDESC86320: The old man starts telling you, that Ka'b ibn Malik reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Two hungry wolves loose among sheep do not cause as much damage as that caused to a man's deen by his greed for money and reputation.'
EVTDESC86330: The old man says that, the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, would often pray, 'O Allah! I seek your protection from anxiety and grief, from incapacity and laziness, from stinginess and cowardice, and from the burden of debt and the domination of people.'
EVTOPTA86330: I bow my head and say the same prayer.
EVTDESC86340: The old man says that, Abu Hurayra reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Beware of envy. Envy devours good actions as fire devours wood.'
EVTDESC86350: The old man says that, Ibn Mas'ud reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, 'Truthfulness leads to piety and piety leads to the Garden. A man should be truthful until he is written down as truthful in the sight of Allah. Lying leads to deviance and deviance leads to the Fire. A person lies to the point that he is written down as a liar in the sight of Allah.'
EVTOPTA86350: I should be with the truthful!
EVTDESC86360: The old man quotes the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, from Sunan Abu Dawood, "The most evil traits in a man are severe stinginess and uninhibited cowardice!"
EVTOPTA86360: And I am no evil man...
EVTDESC86380: The old man starts telling you, that Abu Bakr as-Siddiq said.. "I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, 'If people see an unjust person, and do not restrain him, Allah is very likely to seize them with retribution from Him.'"
EVTOPTA86380: Allah commands to justice and doing good!
EVTDESC86390: The old man says, "As the holy Qur'an says, 'You desire the attractions of this world, but Allah desires the next world for you!', and 'Yes, you prefer the life of this world, but the next world is better and more lasting.'"
EVTDESC86400: The old man says, As related by Al-Tirmidhi, "I said, O Prophet of Allah, will we be held accountable for what we say? He said, 'May your mother be bereft of you! Is there anything that topples people on their faces into the hellfire other than the jests of their tongues?'"
EVTOPTA86400: I will think more on what I say...
EVTDESC86410: The old man says that Abu Hurairah heard the prophet say "When Allah decreed the Creation He pledged Himself by writing in His book which is laid down with Him: 'My mercy prevails over My wrath'."
EVTOPTA86410: This is wisdom I was not aware of.
EVTDESC86510: As you arrive in Mecca you start preparing for the evening's prayer when you discover that the water in the well is not entirely pure. This would not be valid water to use for ablution.
EVTDESC86511: While performing wudu before the night's prayer, a fellow pilgrim points out an impurity in the water!
EVTDESC86520: As you arrive in Mecca, you change from your travelling clothes and dress in the white ihram clothing. This cloth is intended to make everyone appear the same, as in the eyes of Allah there is no difference between a [Root.GetTitle] and a pauper!
EVTDESC86550: You are now at Kabah itself, and performing the Tawaf. Seven circuits you will walk around the black stone, and each time you complete a circuit you point to the stone and say 'In the name of Allah, Allah is Great, Allah is Great, Allah is Great and praise be to Allah'.
EVTOPTB86550: Only shout the first three times
EVTDESC86600: Performing the Sa'i involved running seven times between the hills of Safa and Marwah. This is done to remember the search for water by Ishmael's mother...
EVTDESC86610: The ninth day in Mecca you perform the Wuquf at Mount Arafat, with the entire afternoon dedicated to contemplative vigil, praying, and reciting the holy Qur'an.
EVTOPTA86610: I feel like I understand more now
EVTDESC86620: When Abraham left Mina and was brought down to al-Aqaba, the Devil appeared to him. Gabriel said to him: 'Pelt him!' so Abraham threw seven stones at him so that he disappeared from him.
EVTDESC86630: To symbolize the mercy God had for Abraham, and replacing his son Ishmael with a ram, which Abraham then sacrificed, we perform the Eid al-Adha while at Mecca.
EVTDESC86700: A group of bandits have forced our party to make a stand. We are outnumbered, but with the joy in our heart from our pilgrimage, we have a chance to defeat them!
EVTDESC86701: We accidentally ran into a group of bandits at nightfall, and the guards that I had hired to protect my group proved their worth. All of the infidel bandits have been slain.
EVTOPTA86701: Their loot can come to use.
EVTDESC86720: As you travel back home from Mecca you encounter a very poor village, where even the richest seem to starve.
EVTOPTB86720: I can't afford to help them all..
EVTDESC86800: I have returned to my court a changed man. I am truly humbled before Allah, and I know that all men are equal and can live in harmony with each other.
EVTOPTA86800: There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is the messenger of Allah
EVTDESC86900: A local Imam is berating you as you are getting older and have not yet been on hajj, which is expected of every Muslim once in his life. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] says that as a ruler, I should be an example for my subjects.
EVTOPTA86900: I will soon go to Mecca!
EVTOPTB86900: I am busy preparing a jihad, to liberate fellow Muslims!
EVTDESC86901: [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] is reminding you that you have promised to go to Mecca, and that while Allah is merciful in His wisdom, you have indeed promised Him to go on a pilgrimage.
EVTOPTA86901: I am not a good Muslim...
EVTDESC86902: [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] is reminding you that you had promised to liberate good Muslims living under Christian rule, and there still exists such in the world.
EVTOPTA86902: I am not a good Muslim...
EVTDESC1986: To lie with another [Root.GetManWoman] as you would lie with a [Root.GetManWomanOpp] is sinful, forbidden and if I was to be exposed, death would be my penalty.
EVTDESC3730: The clumsy servant once again managed to cover me in chicken bones, rice and oil and I lost my temper, knocking the servant to the floor in a clatter of broken crockery. My wroth had once again gotten the best of me...
EVTOPTA3730: Next time, your head will hang from the castle walls!
EVTDESC3731: It was not the first time the servant managed to spill food and dirty crockery on [From.GetTitledFirstName] and the furious [From.GetManWoman] sent the servant to the floor with a mighty slap, threatening to hang the servant's head from the castle wall if he ever did it again...
EVTOPTA3731: You should not treat your servants like that!
EVTTOOLTIP3732: is stunned [Root.GetTitledFirstName] dared talk to [This.GetHerHim] like that
EVTOPTB3731: Your servant will certainly be more careful from now on
EVTTOOLTIP3733: is glad [Root.GetTitledFirstName] understands why it is so important to discipline bad servants
EVTDESC3732: When the servant finally came to and started collecting the broken crockery, [From.GetTitledFirstName] couldn't help but comment on what had transpired before [From.GetHerHim]. Apparently, I was not to chastise my own servants, not even when they shamed me in front of guests!
EVTOPTA3732: Don't you tell me what I might or might not do!
EVTDESC3733: 'You did right, chastising your clumsy servant like this. From now on, he will certainly be more careful if he do not wish to have his head hung up on the castle walls!'\n[From.GetTitledFirstName] spoke approvingly of me punishing the servant for spilling food.
EVTDESC100550: The [Root.Religion.GetName] imams are constantly pestering me about religion, [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and money to the zakat. No matter what I do, promise to pray more or read the Qur'an more thoroughly they won't leave me alone!
EVTOPTB100550: Allah, help me be a better Muslim!
EVTDESC100551: I find it curious that the [From.Religion.GetName] imams are constantly pestering [From.GetTitledFirstName] no matter what [From.GetSheHe] promises to do or no matter how much money [From.GetSheHe] gives for the zakat.
EVTOPTB100551: I don't want to do anything to make the imams upset
EVTTOOLTIP100553: is discouraged that the [This.Religion.GetName] imams frighten [Root.GetTitledFirstName] so
EVTDESC100552: 'All the [Root.Religion.GetName] imams care about is money. Give them money whenever they come visiting and they will leave you alone for weeks, if not months for fear of being sinful: no imam want to admit to the sin of being greedy.'\n[From.GetTitledFirstName] advised me soundly and I agreed to try it.
EVTOPTB100552: It's not only the imams who are greedy...
EVTDESC100553: It seems as if no one wants to help me for fear of upsetting the [Root.Religion.GetName] imams, not even my friend [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
EVTOPTA100553: The pestering imams are getting worse!
EVTDESC100554: [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me [From.GetSheHe] had a great advice for me on how to stop the [Root.Religion.GetName] imams pestering me and [From.GetSheHe] got my undivided attention. The problem, though, was that [From.GetTitledFirstName] wanted payment for [From.GetHerHis] advice!
EVTDESC100555: My advice to [From.GetTitledFirstName] was very simple: just pay the [From.Religion.GetName] imams and they'll stop pestering you for, oh perhaps a few weeks? Though I could have shared this for free I decided to test how much [From.GetTitledFirstName] wanted to be left alone by the [From.Religion.GetName] imams and demanded money for the advice.
EVTDESC1632: I find religion fascinating, especially when the Qur'an talk of heathens and infidels, and how they shall be struck down!
EVTDESC2132: My little [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] always has [From.GetHerHis] nose in the Qur'an, and spends all [From.GetHerHis] time among the imams.
EVTDESC1732: People are naive fools, laughing, dancing and nodding like puppets to the false tune played by imams. Charlatans all!
EVTDESC1733: The imam's admonishment bored me to tears, then he told my [GetFromRelation] about my cynicism. [From.GetSubjectPronounCap] tried beating it out of me...
EVTDESC3010: I was shamefully caught in action with a beautiful servant today by [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetBestName]. [Root.job_spiritual.GetSheHeCap] scolded me and lectured me in the virtues of chastity.
EVTDESC3371: I told the imam about my ambitions and asked if there were anything he could do to help me.
EVTDESC3456: I expressed my views on the whole religion and 'Allah' thing a bit too loud and got into a lot of trouble with an imam because of it.
EVTDESC4041: The imam accused a couple of villagers of blasphemy after he heard them take Allah's name in vain. The blacksmith did it when he hit his thumb with the hammer, the stablemaster when a horse kicked him and the cook when a rat fell into the stew.
EVTDESC5026: My subjects does not like the new impaling punishment and, led by the imams, show their umbrage by throwing rotten vegetables at me!
EVTDESC6030_MUS: I am speaking in tongues, screaming obscenities at random times, most often when the imam is talking and am sometimes lying on the ground writhing in apparent pain. I seldom remember these things and people believe me to be possessed.
EVTDESC6031_MUS: By reciting The Throne Verse from the Qur'an and invoking Allah's help the imam managed to repair the damage in me caused by sihr or witchcraft. To be on the safe side, we also recited together the three last suras from the Qur'an: Surat al-Ikhlas (The Fidelity), Surat al-Falaq (The Dawn) and Surat al-Nas (Mankind).
EVTOPTA6031_ALL: Once again, to be on the safe side...
EVTDESC1002: The cook had prepared a magnificent meal, with lots of different fruits, various kinds of meat, plenty of freshly baked bread and several mature cheeses.
EVTOPTB3553: [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] help me! I do have a problem!
EVTDESC1920: Serving [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] should be our goal in life. How can I do it the best way?
EVTOPTD38233: Only Allah decides over life and death
EVTOPTC20021: I thank Allah for saving me
EVTOPTB20030: I am a faithful Muslim, I won't put up with this!
EVTDESC20032:
My [Root.GetTitle], word has reached me that your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] has accused me of heresy! I implore you, as a devout [Root.Religion.GetName] to another devout [Root.Religion.GetName] to believe me when I tell you I am not a heretic!

Your humble [From.GetTitle],
[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC20034: My [Root.GetLordSpiritualName], after investigating the heretic further I can assure you that [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is a devout [FromFrom.Religion.GetName]. If this mistake recur I will not be as understanding. Make sure the heretic really is a heretic before you falsely accuse anyone.\n]\n[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC8000:
For far too long you have blocked my righteous right to [From.GetPlot]. Recognize my rightful claim and step down peacefully or meet me sword in hand. Rest assure that I have enough supporters to obtain this either way...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC72039: Both [From.GetTitledFirstName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] reentered my castle without any visible wounds. It seemed as if [From.GetTitledFirstName] had refused to duel [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTDESC5023: 'Atone for thy sins!'\n\nMy subjects do not like the new impaling punishment and, led by the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s, show their umbrage by throwing rotten vegetables at me!
EVTDESC73001: My young wife has taken a passion for romantic poetry. She keeps reading any sort of romantic poetry she can get hold of.
EVTOPTD73001: These are books created by Shaytan!
EVTDESC20172:
My lord, your [Root.GetChancellorName] [FromFrom.GetTitledName] tried to encourage me to turn against my liege [From.Liege.GetTitledName]! This shameless act can not go unpunished and to stop further interference I have thus decided to imprison your [Root.GetChancellorName] for an indefinite period of time.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
EVTOPTC3126: May Allah have mercy on my soul
EVTOPTD38211: It is all part of Allah's plan
EVTOPTD38227: Give the money to the poor and Allah will see your goodness
EVTOPTC64090: Ask for Allah's help with our childless marriage
EVTDESC91000: The excesses of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Dynasty have gone too far. A dynamic warrior clan has taken up arms and is riding to purify the realm of our decadence!
DECLARE_WAR_INTERACTION_5: §RWhile attacking a fellow [Recipient.Religion.GetName] [Recipient.Religion.GetGroupName], we will lose §Y$PIETY$§R Piety per month!§!
REVOKE_TITLE_INTERACTION_2G: Our Muslim administration allows us to revoke Emirates without objections from the aristocracy.
go_on_hajj_desc: Going on a pilgrimage to Mecca is one of the pillars of Islam, and this is something every able-bodied Muslim is expected to do once in his life. Decadent characters will get rid of the trait.
sadaqah_saddka: Sadaqah: Give a voluntary charity to extinguish my sins
sadaqah_saddka_desc: I will give voluntarily of my wealth and hope Allah and the Caliph will hear of my piety
sadaqah_voluntary_charity: The Caliph will hear of my charity, my sins will be forgiven and my piety increased
EVTDESC31000: The sadaqah, the voluntarily charity [From.GetTitledFirstName] so generously have given to the poor to help eliminate inequality and help those who have less than [From.GetSheHe] is commendable!
EVTDESC31001: The [Root.Religion.GetName] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has heard of me giving Sadaqah, and sends [From.GetHerHis] blessings!
EVTDESC1060: The glance was intentional lascivious and the [Root.GetManWomanOpp] did not hide [Root.GetHerHisOpp] appreciation, nor hide [Root.GetHerHisOpp] lustful thoughts and invited me to join [Root.GetHerHimOpp]...
EVTDESC5070: The pleasures of life, or the pleasures of the after-life? Everything one longs for in this world, will be there in the Garden, Jannah. But life shouldn't be dull, without flavour or pleasures! This is a true dilemma...
EVTOPTA5070: I live life in the moment
EVTOPTB5070: Find true beauty and pleasure through poetry instead
EVTDESC5071: An abundance of food, wine and good company, the hedonism lifestyle seems to make me forget the grey world outside and I indulge in everything...
EVTOPTA5071: ...but I feel empty inside, there's no creativity in hedonism
EVTOPTB5071: This is the life for me!
EVTTOOLTIP5073: has decided what [Root.GetHerHis] lifestyle will be
EVTOPTC5071: I have had enough, hedonism is not the lifestyle for me
EVTDESC5072: There's inspiration to get from everything, from the breakfast I devour to the sight of sunlight illuminating the flowers in my garden, from the works of Imru' al-Qais or The Story of Bayad and Riyad.
EVTOPTA5072: I have tired of this! Let me enjoy the pleasures of life instead
EVTTOOLTIP5074: Poetry speaks to [Root.GetTitledFirstName] as nothing else has done before
EVTOPTC5072: Poetry is nice, but perhaps I will find something better
EVTDESC5073: It is the most important decision in my life. I truly enjoy all the pleasure hedonism brings me and its rules, to only do what pleasures you the most, is one I gladly follow.
EVTOPTB5073: Hedonism is not a lifestyle I seek to pursue for ever...
EVTDESC5074: The poetic lifestyle awaits me, if I truly believe it is the one lifestyle for me. I have learnt more about my people's traditions, life and culture by immersing myself in reading and writing poetry.
EVTOPTB5074: Poetry is not a lifestyle I seek to pursue for ever...
EVTDESC5047: We started early, when the sun had barely risen above the horizon. Game was plentiful, no hunter returned without a hare or fowl tied to their saddle.
EVTDESC3264: I am not the most martial of rulers and sometimes it appears as if I am almost incompetent when it comes to handling the sword. Luckily, I know how to manipulate people...
EVTOPTC38229: This will turn [From.GetHerHim] into a great master of the sword!
EVTDESC100005: Whenever we play, me in the middle most times, there's one child who instead of joining us laughing as loud and as much as we do goes away to read under the shadow of a tree or near the flaming fireplace. Why read dusty, boring old books when you could play with swords or dolls or catch frogs in the pond?
EVTDESC38269: Following [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s will is more important than anything else. I have gained the Zealous trait.
EVTDESC2120: I caught my [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName] lying to me again, straight to my face without batting an eye. I almost had an innocent servant sent to the stocks!
EVTOPTE38233: [From.GetTitledFirstName] will be well soon, there's no need for a doctor!
EVTDESC20040: Due to your recent charity work on behalf of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], one of [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] vassals has become impressed with [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] great generosity.
EVTDESC20041: The [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has been performing charity in [From.Location.GetName], donating alms and food to those in need. The local peasants have benefitted greatly from the [From.Host.GetTitle]'s generosity.
EVTOPTA20041: Perhaps there is still some good in this world.
EVTDESC20042: Your [FromFrom.GetJobTitle], [FromFrom.GetTitledName], reports that [From.GetTitledName] has been humbled by your endless generosity to the poor in [From.Location.GetName]. The peasants are singing your name!
EVTDESC20043: It seems your selfless charity work in [Root.Location.GetName] has attracted a little too much attention. Before you know it, you are surrounded by a huge crowd of hungry and desperate beggars who claw at your robes, pleading for food.
EVTOPTA20043: By the Prophet, let me through!
EVTDESC20044: Before the beggars have a chance to completely envelop you, you cut a swath through the crowd by madly swinging your staff around. You manage to land several solid blows on an old woman with your staff, knocking her few remaining teeth out, and an expertly aimed kick at a malnourished farmer leaves him with a broken nose. The crowd scatters.
EVTOPTA20044: Well, I was told to give generously to the people...
EVTDESC20045: When you finally emerge into daylight again after pushing your way through the desperate crowd, you do so covered in bruises and with your robe in tatters.
EVTDESC20046: Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and has been seriously wounded while giving alms to the poor in your name. Charity can be dangerous work.
EVTDESC20047: Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], who was performing charity work in your name, made the ultimate sacrifice when he was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and trampled to death.
EVTDESC70041: As I draw my last breath I remember the tournament. Alas, my death will set stop for the festivities and I grieve for myself, to think I will never be allowed to see brave knights fight for glory!
EVTOPTA70041: I hope my subjects will remember me as a benevolent ruler
EVTTOOLTIP70042: Your vassals will be informed of your untimely death
EVTDESC70042:
Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], due to [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s untimely death the tournament unfortunately has been cancelled.

Signed, 
[Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTA70042: And I had so looked forward to this!
EVTDESC3656: The storyteller told the tale about the Wild Hunt. The story gave me shivers but the drink made me brave, so instead of sleeping in the tavern I made my way to the castle. I regretted it when the black, huge and hideous huntsmen riding on black horses, with black dogs by their side started chasing me. I screamed and ran for my life, until I heard the huntsmen break out in laughter.
EVTDESC20048: So much of your master's wealth has been squandered on ungrateful and undeserving beggars, but what of you? Have you not toiled enough to improve the lot of thieves and the depraved? Perhaps it would be best if some of that wealth found its way into your own pockets...
EVTOPTA20048: Yes, it would only be right.
EVTOPTB20048: No, I must not forget my duties.
EVTDESC20049: Word has reached you that your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has given in to weakness and helped [From.GetHerselfHimself] to the alms [From.GetSheHe] was meant to distribute amongst the poor.
EVTOPTA20049: Return the gold and all may be forgiven.
action_charity_desc: Send your [GetLordSpiritualName] to perform charity in a province, helping those in need.
EVTTOOLTIP20421: The treacherous acts of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] greatly upsets [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTTOOLTIP100501: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] embraces [From.GetTitledFirstName], [Root.GetHerHis] former rival, in honor of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]'s teachings
EVTDESC63013:

EVTDESC89000: You have come to share more things than your husband with one of his other wives. The mutual feelings of love and affection that exist between the two of you is something you have simply never felt with [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName].

EVTOPTC89006: Force her to drink the vial's remaining content!

EVTOPTB89010: No. [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] is first amongst my wives, now and always.

EVTOPTA105042: I do not believe you but there's nothing I can do
EVTOPTB105042: Your words are false, the punishment will be brought upon you

Instead, [From.GetTitledFirstName] did not deny anything and told me the love [From.GetSheHe] felt for [From.GetHerHis] lover was sacred!
