EVTDESC88250: A messenger arrives with an invitation to all the warriors of the land to take part in Furusiyya, a great martial competition held but once per reign to determine who is the greatest.
EVTOPTB88250: Pah. For children playing at being men.
EVTDESC88251: The Furusiyya begins and the coming two months shall separate those gifted with the skills of a warrior from those who would only pretend at such.
EVTOPTB88251: Alas, the ongoing war demands my attention.
EVTDESC88252: The Furusiyya has come to an end and the stories of its great heroes and their unfortunate victims are already spreading throughout the land.
EVTDESC88253: The Furusiyya has ended, and though I was bested by some participants, I also saw victory more than once. The promise I show as a warrior cannot be denied.
EVTDESC88254: The Furusiyya has ended and my martial prowess is no longer considered idle boasting - it is proven fact. Though there were a handful of warriors gifted with skills superior to my own, the glory I won is enough to make me a hero in the eyes of the people.
EVTDESC88255: The Furusiyya has reached its end and not a moment too soon. My performance left much to be desired, and I would have suffered worse if some of my opponents had not pitied me.
EVTDESC88256: The Furusiyya has ended and though I did make a name for myself, it was not the one I had hoped for. I lost to every challenger, and when I pushed through the crowds and fled in panic in the last wrestling duel, I could hear laughter behind me...
EVTDESC88257: The end of the Furusiyya has come, and I have learned much from the skilled warriors who attended. Both my swordsmanship and archery have improved.
EVTDESC88258: The Furusiyya has reached its end, and the combat techniques I had practised did not work well against real, thinking opponents. I am not quite the fighter I thought I was...
EVTOPTA88258: Perhaps if I improved my footwork...
EVTDESC88259: As my opponent skillfully plunged his blade into my belly and I fell on my back, I reflected briefly on the unfairness of the universe. Then I focused on my fading heartbeat as the blue sky above turned darker and darker...
EVTDESC88260: My horse bucked wildly to the side as my opponent rushed past on his camel, and I was thrown to the ground. When my senses returned, I noticed my arm was bent at a strange angle...
EVTOPTA88260: A pox on that camel jockey!
EVTDESC88261: I was facing an opponent in a game of chess, and while pondering my opening moves, the game next to ours turned violent. One of the players hurled the board aside to pull out his scimitar, sending chess pieces flying everywhere. One of White's Bishops struck me in the eye.
EVTOPTA88261: By the Prophet, that is an illegal move!
EVTDESC88262: To my great shame, the challenge of keeping my bowels in check during the martial competition proved too much for me. I fled home to escape the taunts of my former comrades and for a change of underwear.
EVTOPTA88262: I should have stayed in bed this morning.
EVTDESC88263: Suddenly, in the middle of a frenzied melee, the crowds part to reveal a giant swordsman grinning at you. After he shows off some fancy moves with his sword, the crowds turn expectantly to you. You fling a dagger into the thug's throat and he drops dead to the wild cheers of those nearby.
EVTDESC88264: There were many who doubted my fighting ability, but when we rode our horses into mock battle only to be ambushed by our opponents, I was the one who led us to victory against all odds.
EVTOPTA88264: I am tougher than I look.
EVTDESC88265: As we rode our horses into battle in yet another test of skill, I devised a clever ambush against our opponents. We prevailed despite being outnumbered.
EVTDESC88266: Many believe that chess is the ultimate test of strategy, and if this is true, your brilliance as a general is undeniable. All who have mustered the courage to challenge you in this game have met with defeat.
EVTDESC88267: You are renowned for your skills in strategy and planning, but several defeats in mock battles due to embarrassing mistakes on your part have put this reputation into question.
EVTOPTA88267: I should have seen through that feint...
EVTDESC88268: No matter how hard you try, you cannot wrap your head around this stupid game called chess. Your opponents always seem to be several moves ahead of you.
EVTOPTA88268: It is a game for children and weaklings!
EVTDESC88269: After repeatedly falling off my horse during a competitive event, many have questioned my abilities as a warrior.
EVTDESC88270: I have emerged from the Furusiyya as the finest warrior of the land. I have bested all challengers, and my skills at archery and horsemanship have proved second to none.
EVTDESC88271: I have been declared the second champion of the Furusiyya. Few are those who can match my martial prowess.
EVTOPTA88271: May my enemies quake in fear!
EVTDESC88272: I have been named third champion of the Furusiyya. My efforts in these competitions have proved that I belong in a small circle of elite warriors.
EVTDESC88273: Though I did not participate myself, I felt particularly drawn to the wrestling challenges of the Furusiyya...
EVTDESC88274: While others busied themselves with martial exploits during the Furusiyya, I found the time to embark on different challenges in the many tents that have cropped up just outside the tournament grounds. Like the other fighters, however, I too suffer from battle sores...
EVTDESC88275: My shortcomings in the Furusiyya competitions do not seem quite as significant after helping myself to a healthy serving of wine. Though it is haram, forbidden, surely a few more drops won't hurt...
EVTDESC88276: A fighter had the nerve to insult me in front of several of the other attending warriors. The look on his face when I challenged him to a duel revealed him for the coward he was, but honor left him no choice but to accept. I showed no mercy when I cut him down in single combat.
EVTOPTA88276: All arguments should be settled thus.
EVTDESC88277: As I waited my turn in the archery contest, I came across two bedouins, fierce warriors both, who were plotting to get back at a young noble who had dismissed them as desert rabble. I watched as they carefully cut the girth of the noble's saddle just enough to ensure it would snap during the upcoming riding challenge.
EVTDESC88278: As I waited my turn in the archery contest, I came across two bedouins, fierce warriors both, who were plotting to get back at a young noble who had dismissed them as desert rabble. I told them to face the man directly instead of scheming behind his back like bitter old women!
EVTOPTA88278: No more of this cowardly intrigue!
EVTDESC88279: Learned men from all around the land have come to the Furusiyya to observe the spectacle and share insights and wisdom with each other. Between bouts in the wrestling arena, I spent some time listening to their discussions and learned much about how best to rule the land.
EVTDESC88280: Learned men from all around the land have come to the Furusiyya to observe the spectacle and share insights and wisdom with each other. I joined one of their debates and offered my own opinions on how to govern, only to have them laugh in my face!
EVTOPTA88280: Old fools. What do they know?
EVTDESC88281: Two men assigned to my cavalry wing for the upcoming mock battle were constantly at each other's throats. It was clear they would sooner fight each other than our opponents, so for the sake of our team I decided to mediate in their conflict.
EVTOPTA88281: They agreed to set aside their differences.
EVTDESC88282: Two men assigned to my cavalry wing for the upcoming mock battle were constantly at each other's throats. It was clear they would sooner fight each other than our opponents, so I called them out like the bickering women they were and demanded they settle their differences in a duel.
EVTOPTA88282: Sadly both were badly wounded and our wing suffered as a result...
EVTDESC88283: Riders have been sent to all the corners of the land, spreading word that the great martial competition of Furusiyya will soon be held.
EVTDESC88284: [From.GetTitledName] has been named first champion of my great Furusiyya.
EVTDESC88285: [From.GetTitledName] has performed well enough to be named second champion of my great Furusiyya.
EVTDESC88286: The third champion of my Furusiyya is none other than [From.GetTitledName].
EVTDESC88287: The great Furusiyya competition of [From.GetTitledName] has sadly been cancelled due to war.
EVTOPTA88287: Then my skill at fighting may still see use.
EVTDESC88288: Master, your honored guest, [From.GetTitledName], has sadly perished during the events of the Furusiyya.
EVTOPTA88288: May [From.GetSheHe] find peace in the life hereafter.
EVTOPTB88288: Tell me of the heroes, not the failures!
EVTDESC88289: Master, your honored guest, [From.GetTitledName], has sadly been maimed during the events of the Furusiyya.
EVTOPTB88289: Tell me of the heroes, not the failures!
EVTDESC88290: Master, your honored guest, [From.GetTitledName], has sadly suffered serious wounds during the events of the Furusiyya.
EVTOPTB88290: Tell me of the heroes, not the failures!
EVTDESC88291: As death closes in on me and I prepare for the life hereafter, I spare a thought for the great Furusiyya I had planned. Sadly the competition will end upon my passing, and the fighters will have to find some other way to prove their worth.
EVTOPTA88291: May those I ruled remember me for my wisdom, Insha'Allah.
EVTDESC88292:
Peace be upon you, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. Due to the sudden and unexpected passing of [From.GetTitledFirstName], the Furusiyya has sadly been cancelled.

Signed, 
[Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTA88292: But I was going to prove myself as a fighter!
hold_a_furusiyya_desc: We shall hold a Furusiyya martial competition to determine once and for all who the best fighters of the land are.
EVTDESC88500: The holy month of Ramadan is upon us, and all faithful Muslims, save the infirm and those on a journey, must observe the fast during daylight hours.
EVTDESC88501: Ramadan is a blessed time for charity and kindness, and in that spirit you could release the prisoners languishing in your dungeons...
EVTOPTB88501: No, they are where they belong.
EVTDESC88502: The Prophet, may Allah honor him and grant him peace, teaches the importance of charity and good deeds, especially during the holy month of Ramadan. There are many poor in [Root.Location.GetName] who could be helped if you but parted with some of your treasury.
EVTOPTA88502: Yes, make it so. Distribute alms to the poor.
EVTOPTB88502: No, I would not disturb their fast by giving them means to buy food...
EVTDESC88503: Now is the time for prayers and devoted reading of the Qur'an. After the sun has set, you could recite the Qur'an through Tarawih prayers.
EVTOPTA88503: Yes, I will thus draw nearer to Allah.
EVTOPTB88503: No, I do not have the time to spare.
EVTDESC88504: The strict fast you have been observing during the daylight hours of Ramadan has weakened you to the point of illness. As the ill are exempted from fasting, there would be no shame or loss of piety if you abandoned the fast and made up for the lost days at a later time. If you continue, however, there could be serious repercussions to your health...
EVTOPTA88504: Yes, I need time to recover from this...
EVTDESC88505: Your decision to continue fasting despite your illness has proved a costly one. You have become infirm with weakness due to lack of food and water, and left with no choice but to interrupt the fast.
EVTDESC88506: The fast you have observed during Ramadan has taught you the value of moderation in all things, and the dangers of indulgence and excess. You feel closer to Allah.
EVTDESC88507: You have given generously to the poor during Ramadan and performed many good deeds. The urge to help those in need comes naturally to you.
EVTOPTA88507: I feel like a better person.
EVTDESC88508: The ongoing war demands your full attention, and you and your men can no longer continue your fast. You will have to make up the lost days at a later date.
EVTDESC88509: You have become ill and will have to abandon the fast. The lost days will have to be made up at a later date.
EVTDESC88510: The end of Ramadan approaches, and that means the holiday of Eid ul-Fitr is upon us. The preparations for the planned feast to celebrate this have already been made, and now the time has come to invite your vassals to your palace. What say you, Master?
EVTOPTB88510: No, I have a headache. Cancel the festivities!
EVTDESC88511:
Peace be upon you, [Root.GetTitledName]. The end of Ramadan draws near, and to celebrate the holiday of Eid ul-Fitr I have decided to hold a great feast in my palace. You are of course invited.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC88512:
Peace be upon you, [Root.GetTitledName]. I give thanks for your invitation to celebrate Eid ul-Fitr at your palace, but I regret to inform you I cannot attend.

Your servant,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC88513: The great banquet you ordered held to celebrate Eid ul-Fitr and the end of Ramadan was a rousing success! The food was exceptional, the entertainment magnificent and a great time was had by all. Your guests seemed suitably impressed by your wealth and generosity.
EVTDESC88514: The great banquet held by [From.GetTitledName] to celebrate Eid ul-Fitr and the end of Ramadan was a splendid occasion. The food was exceptional, the entertainment magnificent and a great time was had by all.
EVTDESC88515: To celebrate Eid ul-Fitr, perhaps you should present a gift to your beloved wife.
EVTOPTA88515: Of course! I will buy her a golden necklace.
EVTOPTB88515: No, my affection for her is gift enough.
EVTDESC88516: To celebrate Eid ul-Fitr, perhaps you should present gifts to your beloved wives.
EVTOPTA88516: Yes, but only for [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], my dear first wife.
EVTOPTB88516: Of course, they will all see my love!
EVTOPTC88516: My affection for them is gift enough.
EVTDESC88517: The hunger pains you experience during the fast have become unbearable due to your gluttonous nature. With the sun still high in the sky, you break into the pantry and help yourself to the food inside while tears stream down your face...
EVTDESC88518: Overcome with lust and in broad daylight during the fast, you sinfully engage in the pleasures of the flesh with a serving girl.
EVTOPTA88518: I should not have done that...
EVTDESC88519: Though the fast requires you to abstain from food and drink during the daylight hours, you helped yourself to enough wine to fall into a drunken stupor.
EVTDESC88520: Many in [Root.Location.GetName] have donated generously to provide for the poor during the holy month of Ramadan. The gold has been gathered in an urn but when you approach it to donate your own share, your greedy nature results in your coin purse gaining weight instead of losing it...
EVTOPTA88520: No one will miss a few coins...
EVTDESC88521: As a cynical unbeliever, you do your best to uphold the appearance of observing the fast, but behind closed doors you do not think twice about eating and drinking to your heart's content, be it day or night. One day you are caught in the act...
EVTOPTA88521: I-It's not what it looks like!
observe_ramadan_desc: As a Muslim you observe the fast of Ramadan every year, but you will be paying particular adherence to it this time. Upon its conclusion, a great banquet will be held to celebrate the Eid ul-Fitr holiday.
EVTDESC88522: Your fast and observance of the holy month of Ramadan has ended.
EVTDESC105050: I wish to decorate the new mosque with abstract arabesque motifs such as quotes from the Qur'an and intricate calligraphy is something my liege's new Court Calligrapher should be more than able to do.
EVTOPTA105050: With the Court Calligrapher's help, the mosque should look wonderful!
EVTTOOLTIP105051: Court Calligrapher [This.GetTitledFirstName] is asked to create designs for the decoration of the new Mosque
EVTOPTB105050: I should not disturb the Court Calligrapher with such a petty task
EVTDESC105051: A message from [From.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived, with a most respectful tone to it and a humble request for calligraphy of Quranic verses for the decoration of a newly erected mosque.
EVTOPTA105051: I would be more than honored to create designs for the decoration
EVTTOOLTIPA105052: The calligraphy Quranic verses is much appreciated by [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTTOOLTIPB105052: Despite [Root.GetTitledFirstName] hard work with the calligraphy Quranic verses, the designs and effort is not appreciated by [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTB105051: My work would only be spoiled in a mosque of such petty calibre
EVTTOOLTIPB105053: The Court Calligrapher [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s refusal is most disappointing to [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC105052: I received samples of what the Court Calligrapher [From.GetTitledFirstName] had envisioned for the decoration of the mosque, taken special care to the few Quranic verses I had felt most important to adorn the roof and walls of the mosque.
EVTTOOLTIPA105054: The work of Court Calligrapher [This.GetTitledFirstName] is praised by [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTTOOLTIPA105055: The excellence of the Court Calligrapher reaches [This.GetTitledFirstName] ears
EVTOPTB105052: The design looks as if a three-year-old has smeared ink over the pergament!
EVTTOOLTIPB105054: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] tells the Court Calligrapher [This.GetTitledFirstName] how terrible the designs are
EVTTOOLTIPB105055: The pitiful designs has even reached the eyes of [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTC105052: The designs are good, but [From.GetTitledFirstName] can do better
EVTOPTD105052: The designs are awful, but I cannot tell [From.GetTitledFirstName] that!
EVTDESC105053: I had thought it to be a great honor, designing the decorations of my mosque and I had even sent [From.GetTitledFirstName] some Quranic verses to give [From.GetHerHim] some ideas of what I wanted together with a most humble letter praising [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s calligraphic skill. The short answer was humiliating in its simplicity:
EVTDESC105054: I sent [From.GetTitledFirstName] some short samples of my previous works and the design of the Quranic verses [From.GetSheHe] had specifically asked for. The messenger arrived with a letter from [From.GetTitledFirstName] and I tore it open to reveal what [From.GetTitledFirstName] had written in response to my designs...
EVTOPTA105054: [From.GetSheHeCap] loved it! Time to start working seriously on this!
EVTOPTC105054: [From.GetSheHeCap] chided me for not taking this seriously!
EVTDESC105055: I saw the design of the Quranic verses my Court Calligrapher [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] had created for [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s new mosque and I couldn't believe anyone would be dissatisfied with it, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is a master with the qalam!
EVTOPTA105055: [From.GetTitledFirstName] was most pleased with the designs
EVTOPTC105055: [From.GetTitledFirstName] pointed out several flaws in the design, deeming it unworthy
EVTDESC105060: The hilya I have worked on for so long is a piece of art, the description of the Prophet Mohammad's appearance and character written in gold with as much care taken to every line and curve as to every dot as I could possibly do. The brilliant colors and exquisite details is a joy to behold!
EVTOPTA105060: I should send the hilya to the [Root.Religion.GetName] Caliph!
EVTTOOLTIPA105061: The Caliph [This.GetTitledFirstName] is most pleased with the hilya
EVTOPTB105060: I should honor my liege [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and send [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] the hilya
EVTOPTC105060: I shall sell this hilya and make a new one with the money
EVTDESC105061: [From.GetTitledFirstName] sent me a hilya [From.GetSheHe] had made [From.GetHerselfHimself], a description of the Prophet Mohammad's appearance and character written in gold on pergament with hopes of it protecting me from trouble in this world and the next.
EVTOPTB105061: Accept this small token of my appreciation for the hilya
EVTOPTC105061: Did I ask for this? I have hilyas much more intricate and beautiful than this!
EVTDESC105065: With the promise of creating a golden Qur'an, with ornaments of gold and cover of solid gold, something only the most skilled and experienced calligraphers would ever be able to create, I might be able to lure my liege [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] for some money!
EVTOPTA105065: Ask [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] to pay for the 'whole book'
EVTTOOLTIPA105066: The materials for the 'Golden Qur'an' might be paid for by [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTB105065: Ask [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] to pay for part of it
EVTTOOLTIPB105066: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] ask [This.GetTitledFirstName] to help pay for the materials for the 'Golden Qur'an'
EVTOPTC105065: My dream will remain a dream...
EVTDESC105066: The idea of a golden Qur'an might be absurd, the cost for the gold alone incredible but I listened patiently as the Court Calligrapher [From.GetTitledFirstName] told me about [From.GetHerHis] plans and ideas, the approximately cost of the materials needed including the gold and [From.GetHerHis] time estimate. It started to sound promising, then [From.GetTitledFirstName] asked me...
EVTOPTA105066: To pay for all the materials? Yes, of course!
EVTTOOLTIPA105067: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will help [This.GetTitledFirstName] by paying for materials for the Golden Qur'an
EVTOPTB105066: To help pay for some of the materials? As long as that is all you need...
EVTOPTC105066: No, I won't help you. 'Golden Qur'an', absurd!
EVTTOOLTIPB105067: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] refusal to help pay for the Golden Qur'an disappoints [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC105067: With a rough estimate of what the materials for the Golden Qur'an would cost and a time estimate of about six months I managed to make [From.GetTitledFirstName] more than interested in my 'dream' of making a Golden Qur'an...
EVTOPTA105067: [From.GetTitledFirstName] agreed to pay for whatever I might need!
EVTOPTB105067: My plan worked, [From.GetTitledFirstName] agreed to pay for some of the 'materials'!
EVTOPTC105067: [From.GetTitledFirstName] refused to pay for 'something so foolish!'
EVTDESC105068: It has been six months since I agreed to help my Court Calligrapher [From.GetTitledFirstName] with [From.GetHerHis] dream of creating a Golden Qur'an and I am starting to become suspicious. I have heard no word of progress, nor seen any sign of the Golden Qur'an or its design and I am starting to believe my Court Calligrapher might have deceived me for money!
EVTOPTD105068: Forgive Court Calligrapher [From.GetTitledFirstName], it's only money!
EVTDESC105069: The Golden Qur'an I promised [From.GetTitledFirstName] I would create for the money [From.GetSheHe] gave me to pay for the materials is of course a figment of imagination, a scheme to lure my liege of some money. Somehow [From.GetTitledFirstName] have found out about my scheme and I am being punished by...
EVTDESC105075: The ghazal's poetic expression of both the pain of separation and the beauty of love in spite of that pain is the perfect poetic form for my next song!
EVTTOOLTIP105076: Court Musician [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s new song is dedicated to [Root.GetHerHis] liege's wife [Root.Liege.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTB105075: [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] will be the first to hear it!
EVTTOOLTIPA105077: Court Musician [Root.GetTitledFirstName] sing [Root.GetHerHis] new song for [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTC105075: I need more time before I can master this form
EVTDESC105076: My husband's Court Musician [From.GetTitledFirstName] has a wonderful voice and I could barely keep from blushing as I heard [From.GetHerHim] sing [From.GetHerHis] ghazal song about the pain of separation and the beauty of love in spite of that pain...
EVTOPTA105076: Wonderful! Our court would be less beautiful without your voice
EVTOPTB105076: It is not proper for a man to court a married woman!
EVTTOOLTIP105077: [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s husband [This.GetTitledFirstName] hears about the Court Musician courting his wife
EVTDESC105077: The Court Musician's words and his singing brought justice to the poetic form ghazal, a poetic expression of both the pain of separation and the beauty of love in spite of that pain.
EVTOPTA105077: Here, a small token of mine and [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s appreciation...
EVTTOOLTIPB105078: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] both appreciated Court Musician [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s song
EVTOPTB105077: How dare you court my wife with this song!?
EVTTOOLTIPC105078: Court Musician [This.GetTitledFirstName] is imprisoned for courting [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] with a song
EVTOPTC105077: Play it just one more time, please?
EVTTOOLTIP105079: Court Musician [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s song is appreciated by [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC105078: As I sang my song, I started to feel true pain of separation from my love and still see the beauty of love. The ghazal was my masterpiece and as I let the last few notes die away I felt tears streaming down my face...
EVTOPTA105078: [From.GetTitledFirstName] was as touched by the song as I were
EVTOPTC105078: [From.GetTitledFirstName] did not appreciate me singing this song to his wife!
EVTDESC105100: 'Through my veins both love and blood flows\nMy beloved fills me as love empties me of myself...'\nAs I struggle with my poem I searched through the garden for an inspiration of some sort...
EVTOPTA105100: I find inspiration in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] and read her the poem
EVTTOOLTIP105101: Court Musician [Root.GetTitledFirstName] inspiration is awakened by [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTB105100: The garden inspired me, present the poem to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTTOOLTIPA105102: Court Musician [Root.GetTitledFirstName] inspiration is awakened by [Root.GetHerHis] liege [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s garden
EVTOPTC105100: No inspiration is to be had, the poem will remain unfinished...
EVTDESC105101: My husband's garden is an easy place to find inspiration within, and I was slowly walking through it when the Court Poet [From.GetTitledFirstName] startled me. [From.GetSheHeCap] asked my forgiveness and recited a poem [From.GetTitledFirstName] claimed to have gotten inspiration to when [From.GetSheHe] saw me walking.
EVTOPTA105101: Not exactly appropriate, but very sweet
EVTTOOLTIP105103: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has nothing but kind words for Court Poet [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s poetry
EVTOPTB105101: Go away! What will my husband say?!
EVTTOOLTIPB105102: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is mortified and tells [Root.GetHerHis] husband [This.GetTitledFirstName] about the Court Poet's poetry
EVTDESC105102:
The poem did not rhyme, why did it not rhyme? Shouldn't every poem rhyme? I was assured by the Court Poet that not all poetry rhymed and I did like the two first sentences:

'Through my veins both love and blood flows
My beloved fills me as love empties me of myself...'
EVTOPTA105102: Good work my dear poet, good work!
EVTTOOLTIPB105103: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] appreciated the poem, although it did not rhyme
EVTOPTB105102: Did you try to seduce my wife with this!? Imprison him!
EVTOPTC105102: This is the most beautiful poem I ever heard!
EVTDESC105103: My new poem was clearly appreciated, people were asking me to make copies of it or just hear me recite it for them. I tried to do this as inconspicuously as possible, I did not want any jealous wife or husbands try to harm me just for a sweet poems sake...
EVTOPTB105103: [From.GetTitledFirstName] even paid me for a copy!
EVTOPTC105103: [From.GetTitledFirstName] did not appreciate me getting inspiration from his wife...
EVTOPTD105103: [From.GetTitledFirstName] was moved to tears by my poem
EVTDESC105150: As the Cupbearer I shall serve drinks at the table, guard against poison in my [Root.Liege.GetTitle]'s cup and sometimes test the wine by tasting it to make sure no one has poisoned it. Too bad I do not like my liege and might accidentally serve bad wine...
EVTTOOLTIP105151: The poison was discovered before any damage was done
EVTOPTB105150: I dare not risk my position at [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court
EVTDESC105151: My trustworthy Cupbearer [From.GetTitledFirstName] served the wine as always and even though it did taste a bit strange I did not reflect upon it until it was too late! The wine must have been poisoned, why else would I feel this way?
EVTTOOLTIPA105152: Cupbearer [This.GetTitledFirstName] is imprisoned by the lunatic [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTB105151: A night of stomach cramps convinced me of [From.GetTitledFirstName] guilt!
EVTTOOLTIPB105152: The poison caused nothing more than stomach cramps, Cupbearer [This.GetTitledFirstName] is imprisoned
EVTOPTC105151: I am merciful when I imprison you, [From.GetTitledFirstName]! You should be dead!
EVTTOOLTIPC105152: [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s imprisons Cupbearer [This.GetTitledFirstName] but would rather see [This.GetHerHim] dead
EVTOPTD105151: For Cupbearer is death! I mean, kill [From.GetHerHim]!
EVTOPTE105151: For your treason you will die!
EVTOPTF105151: I would kill you myself if I had the strength!
EVTDESC105152: It seems my treason reached the wrong ears! The poison in the wine, why did I trust it to kill [From.GetTitledFirstName]? I should have done it with my own two hands!
EVTOPTA105152: At least the bastard is sick as a dog!
EVTOPTC105152: The poison made [From.GetHerHim] insane at least...
EVTDESC105200: I took a look at some of the architecture plans for the buildings being built in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s realm and what I saw chilled my blood. There were so many things that could be improved, so many small faults that could be solved if only [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] would listen to me and provide the money necessary for these changes.
EVTTOOLTIP105201: Chief Architect [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s suggests several changes in the building plans for [This.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTOPTB105200: I need more time, there's probably more flaws I can find...
EVTDESC105201: 'You see, this small change might mean five years more without repairs, and this is just absurd, what were they thinking? Let me have the money needed to do these changes and I promise you...'\nThe Chief Architect pointed out several flaws and faults with the building plans and asked for money to prevent them.
EVTOPTA105201: Whatever you need, just make these buildings sturdy!
EVTTOOLTIPA105202: Chief Architect [This.GetTitledFirstName] is given the money needed to correct flaws in the buildings
EVTOPTB105201: No, I don't want to waste money on this!
EVTTOOLTIPB105202: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has no desire to waste money on the buildings
EVTDESC105202: I saw before me how the buildings would stand tall and beautiful, without the flaws I had found in the building plans. Before me stood the [From.GetManWoman] who held this in [From.GetHerHis] hand and I waited for [From.GetTitledFirstName] decision, eager to get out there and make the buildings flawless.
EVTOPTB105202: I got the money but now I want to keep it!
EVTOPTC105202: I can do so much, save so many buildings from imperfections!
EVTDESC105203: Another building collapsed today! I thought my Chief Architect [From.GetTitledFirstName] had found and corrected these flaws but it seems like [From.GetSheHe] squandered the money away. What should the punishment for this be?
EVTOPTD105203: I'm sure [From.GetTitledFirstName] did [From.GetHerHis] best to stop it from happening
EVTDESC105204: I should have used the money for improvements! Another building collapsed today and [From.GetTitledFirstName] holds me responsible for it. I tremble at the mere thought of whatever punishment [From.GetTitledFirstName] see fit for my failure...
EVTDESC91200: Alcoholic beverages are considered haraam in the Islamic faith - forbidden. This, however, has not stopped you from consuming copious amounts of wine and getting plastered on a regular basis.
EVTDESC91201: Your attraction to those of your same sex is frowned upon by the rest of society, but there are times when you simply grow tired of keeping up appearances. The people do not look kindly on this.
EVTOPTA91201: Let them say what they want!
EVTDESC91202: Some visiting imams walk in on you as your servants are busily smearing your body with honey, covering you from top to bottom. For some reason they react in horror at this sight.
EVTOPTA91202: What? I left enough for tomorrow's breakfast.
EVTDESC91203: It is becoming increasingly difficult to conceal your secret vice - impaling your enemies on wooden stakes and listening to their cries of despair. Concerns have been raised about how appropriate this behavior is for someone of your station.
EVTOPTA91203: You will not rob me of the one thing I enjoy in life!
EVTDESC91204: Why should you settle for one woman, or two, or a dozen? The carnal pleasures of the flesh beckon, and let no man say you are undeserving!
EVTDESC91205: Your enormous appetite cannot be sated. As the poor of your realm starve, your servants bring delicacies from the most distant lands to your table. A 'light lunch' for you would be enough to feed a peasant family for a week or two.
EVTOPTA91205: Let me just remove my belt...
EVTDESC91206: You have been doing your best to suck the people of [Root.Location.GetName] dry of what few possessions they have. No matter how much of their wealth is channeled your way, you always want more. The lifestyle you have grown accustomed to is an expensive one indeed.
EVTDESC91207: The truly enlightened ruler must conserve all energy for the act of ruling itself. It is for this reason that you have expanded your staff of servants tenfold. Tedious activities such as walking, bringing food to your mouth or the wiping of your regal behind are a thing of the past for you.
EVTDESC91208: More and more of your waking hours are being spent comparing your worldly possessions with those of other rulers. For someone of your same station to have a more lavish palace or prettier garments is simply unacceptable.
EVTOPTA91208: I deserve only the very best.
EVTDESC91209: Your foul temper is frequently discussed in hushed voices among your palace staff. Furniture, silverware, mirrors - everything is fair game when your mood turns bad and you feel the need to break or throw something. If your palace was ever looted, would anyone be able to tell the difference?
EVTDESC91210: You order the construction of a massive bronze statue over the main entrance of [Root.Location.GetName] depicting yourself holding a raised sword, challenging the very heavens to strike you down if they dare. This generous gift to the people will help them remember your splendor and brilliance.
EVTOPTA91210: They should be thankful I am their ruler.
EVTDESC91211: Your deceitfulness and guile sometimes serve you well, but it has also earned you a reputation among your subjects as someone who is not to be trusted. They simply do not see you as a man of honor.
EVTOPTA91211: Honour is a weakness I cannot afford.
EVTDESC91212: While there are some rulers who take an active role in military affairs, the safety of the palace life is far more appealing to you. Why, if you ventured beyond the palace gates, something could hurt you!
EVTOPTA91212: Guards, I don't like the way that child looked at me...
EVTDESC91213: While there are always those who moan and mutter about the need to continually better oneself and strive for improvement, you are quite content with the way things are now. The land is yours to rule, you have a beautiful palace and the sun still shines warmly.
EVTOPTA91213: There is not a single thing I would change.
EVTDESC91214: Justice and the rule of law do not interest you, unless they happen to coincide with your own sense of how things should be. Many of your subjects are grumbling about how you seem to hold yourself above the laws they have to observe.
EVTDESC91215: Your cynical view of all religious matters has resulted in you only observing those elements of the Muslim faith you find convenient and ignoring the rest. Some of your subjects are muttering about this lack of piousness on your part.
EVTDESC91216: You suspect everyone around you of treachery, to the point where your servants and staff are terrified of even breathing in your presence. The size and influence of your palace guard has increased tenfold as everything, good or bad, has to pass through them before reaching you.
EVTOPTA91216: They will not catch me unawares.
EVTDESC91217: You take great pleasure in inflicting cruel punishments on your servants and subjects. If there is no reason to punish them, you find it easy enough to invent one.
EVTOPTA91217: I will teach you not to blink so much in my presence...
EVTDESC91218: You always seem to be thinking several steps ahead of the people near you. There are few people alive who can match your mental prowess, and when your intellect is focused on a single problem, people know a solution will be found.
EVTOPTA91218: Allah (glorified and exalted be He) does not play dice.
EVTDESC91219: Your decision to put aside your carnal desires and lead a life of celibacy is applauded by the people, either because they admire your sacrifice or because they are relieved you are less likely to procreate.
EVTDESC91220: As a dedicated scholar, you have gained many valuable insights from all the tomes you have studied. From the Quran to ancient treatises on farming techniques and history, there is great wisdom to be found in all.
EVTOPTA91220: There is so much to learn.
EVTDESC91221: Your chaste and virtuous lifestyle is held as an example even far beyond the borders of those lands belonging to you. If only all men lived thus.
EVTOPTA91221: The world would be a better place.
EVTDESC91222: Where other rulers often abuse their positions and give in to excess, you have always valued moderation in all things. This quality is admired by the people you rule.
EVTDESC91223: You are always ready to give to those less fortunate than yourself, and when a rockslide destroyed the homes of several poor families in [Root.Location.GetName], you offered them temporary lodgings in your palace.
EVTOPTA91223: Every day the sun rises, charity is due on every joint of a person.
EVTDESC91224: Your tireless and diligent work as their ruler has not gone unnoticed by your people. Some have dubbed you 'He Who Appears Everywhere' and claim you possess supernatural powers to exist in more than one place at once.
EVTOPTA91224: I have never been afraid of a little hard work.
EVTDESC91225: You have become renowned for your kind rule, and your people love you for it. There are those who would call you soft, but even they are impressed by the devotion your subjects show you.
EVTDESC91226: Your ability to plan for the long-term and see the big picture has served you well as a ruler. Future generations will thank you for the work you do today!
EVTOPTA91226: Great things come to those who wait.
EVTDESC91227: You always strive to be humble, never forgetting the roots of yourself and your ancestors. There are many lessons from the past that must still be heeded today.
EVTDESC91228: Your honest nature and tendency to speak what is on your mind has ruffled a few feathers in the past, but it has also earned you great respect. People know that your words ring true.
EVTDESC91229: Your enemies would accuse you of many things, but not even they would label you a coward. It is well known that you are fearless and always willing to share the dangers faced by your men.
EVTDESC91230: You are an ambitious man, always striving to improve and do better. The people know this, and though some of your decisions may be unpopular, they are usually at least seen as progressive.
EVTDESC91231: Just and fair in all things, your people rest easy in the knowledge that no matter what, you can always be depended on to observe the rule of law.
EVTDESC91232: No one can question your devotion to Allah and the teachings of his Prophet (peace be upon him). You can always be counted on to put your faith ahead of yourself.
EVTDESC91233: You have proven your devotion to Allah (may He be glorified and exalted) by making war against the enemies of Islam. As one of the mujahideen, you are acknowledged to have fought in a Jihad.
EVTOPTA91233: The best jihad is the one in which your horse is slain and your blood is spilled.
EVTDESC91234: You have completely memorized the Quran, an accomplishment that not only shows your devotion to Allah (glorified and exalted be He), but which has also won you great respect as a ruler.
EVTDESC91235: It is a well known fact that you have completed the Hajj and thus shown your submission and devotion to Allah (may He be glorified and exalted). Whatever else they may say about you, no one can take this away.
EVTDESC105250: Being the Food Taster for [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] can be a dangerous job. I am supposed to taste the food and drink to be served to [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] to make sure it is safe to eat, not poisonous or tastes strange. Lately, I have been secretly trying to become immune to different poisons for I am under the grip of the fear of death.
EVTOPTA105250: If [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] would die because I am immune, even better!
EVTOPTB105250: It is my job to keep my liege safe, I shouldn't try to become immune to poisons!
EVTDESC105251: The food tasted a bit strange, something was hidden beneath the seasoning but I trusted Food Taster [From.GetTitledFirstName] would never serve me anything that might be poisoned. Oh, how I regretted that trust later that evening, when the stomach pains erupted...
EVTOPTD105251: For Foodtaster is death! I mean, kill [From.GetHerHim]!
EVTTOOLTIPA105253: Food Taster [This.GetTitledFirstName] is imprisoned by the lunatic [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTTOOLTIPB105253: The poison caused nothing more than stomach cramps, Food Taster [This.GetTitledFirstName] is imprisoned
EVTTOOLTIPC105253: [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s imprisons Food Taster [This.GetTitledFirstName] but would rather see [This.GetHerHim] dead
EVTDESC105253: My plan to become immune to poisons did not turn out so good, I missed the poisoned food intended for [From.GetTitledFirstName] and that is how I ended up in [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s dungeon...
EVTOPTA105253: [From.GetTitledFirstName] became gravely ill by the poisoned food
EVTOPTB105253: The poison did not even make [From.GetTitledFirstName] sick!
EVTOPTC105253: I fear the poison made [From.GetTitledFirstName] mad
EVTDESC106000: A man named Al-Ghazali has returned to [Root.GetName] after seven years of studying fiqh, the expansion of the code of conduct called sharia. His scholarly interest in sufism, kalam, philosophy, logic and Islamic jurisprudence has led him to start writing a book he calls 'The Incoherence of the Philosophers' which will surely be a masterpiece when it is finished.
EVTOPTA106000: I must introduce this man to my liege!
EVTDESC106001: Al-Ghazali, the scholar from [From.GetName], was well-spoken and respectful, with an incredible knowledge of sufism, kalam, philosophy, logic and fiqh. I invited him to stay at my court, to study and share his knowledge with my court.
EVTOPTA106001: Stay as long as you like
EVTDESC106005: A famous traveller, Muhammad al-Idrisi - a geographer, cartographer and Egyptologist - has arrived to [Root.GetName], a man who can trace his descent through long line of Princes, Caliphs and Sufi leaders, to the Prophet Muhammad. Muhammad al-Idrisi wishes to meet [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTOPTA106005: I will introduce you to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHim] immediately!
EVTDESC106006: A most fascinating man, that traveller Muhammad al-Idrisi! He is a geographer, cartographer and Egyptologist and his famous map Tabula Rogeriana has I myself many times consulted. Muhammad al-Idrisi asks for permission to stay at my court and work on his book 'Kitab nuzhat al-mushtaq' or 'A Diversion for the Man Longing to Travel to Far-Off Places'...
EVTOPTA106006: Certainly! You are welcome to stay here as long as you'd like
EVTDESC106010: A prominent scholar in [Root.GetName] - Ibn Khaldun - who is currently working on the first book of seven of 'Kitabu l-'ibar wa Diwanu l-Mubtada' wa l-Habar fi tarikhi l-'arab wa l-Barbar wa man 'Asarahum min Ðawi Ash-Sha'n l-Akbar' or 'Book of lessons, Record of Beginnings and Events in the history of the Arabs and Berbers and their Powerful Contemporaries' is looking for a patron and is humbly asking me to present him to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTDESC106011: Ibn Khaldun from [From.GetName] honored me when he allowed me to thumb through the first few pages of 'Book of lessons, Record of Beginnings and Events in the history of the Arabs and Berbers and their Powerful Contemporaries', a book that would grow into seven books over several years.
EVTOPTA106011: I would be honored to have you as my guest while you work on your book
EVTDESC106015: Zakariya al-Qazwini from [Root.GetName], who has written a cosmography titled 'Athar al-bilad wa-akhbar al-ibad' or 'Marvels of Creatures and Strange Things Existing', is currently working on a geographical dictionary and is keen on talking to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] to ask for [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHis] patronage.
EVTDESC106016: I am more than familiar with Zakariya al-Qazwini from [Root.GetName], his cosmography titled 'Athar al-bilad wa-akhbar al-ibad' or 'Marvels of Creatures and Strange Things Existing' has long delighted me and taught me more about the strange animals and creatures in our world. Now he is working on yet another book, this time a geographical dictionary and he has asked me for my patronage.
EVTOPTA106016: I cannot wait to read your next book!
EVTDESC106020: A young scholar and teacher named Al-Juwayni in [Root.GetName], originally from Nishapur, has requested an audience with [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] to ask for permission to teach the Ashari theological perspective to all who wishes to learn more.
EVTOPTA106020: Let me see what I can do...
EVTDESC106021: I have been fascinated with the Ashari theological perspective, especially the notion that complete comprehension of the Unique Nature and Attributes of Allah is beyond the capacity of human reasoning and sense experience. The young scholar Al-Juwayni, a teacher of the Ashari theological perspective has asked my permission to start teaching all who wishes in [From.GetName].
EVTDESC106025: In [Root.GetName], a prominent scholar named Kamal al-Din al-Farisi has just published his first book titled 'Asas al-qawa'id fi usul al-fawa'id' or 'The base of the rules in the principles of uses' and he is eager to show it to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTOPTA106025: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] is as eager to meet you as you are to meet [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHim]!
EVTDESC106026: Five chapters of arithmetic, notarial and sales rules, the areas of surfaces and solids, with the last two essays are on algebra, the book 'Asas al-qawa'id fi usul al-fawa'id' or 'The base of the rules in the principles of uses' written by Kamal al-Din al-Farisi is fascinating if you enjoy arithmetic. The man himself has asked for my patronage.
EVTOPTA106026: A renowned scholar like you is always welcomed at my court
EVTDESC106030: A physician in [Root.GetName], Rashid-al-Din Hamadani, is writing a book he will call 'Jami' al-tawarikh' or 'Compendium of Chronicles', a book that will encompass all the history of the world as it has been when it is finished. The cost of producing this book is too great for a mere physician and so he has come to ask [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] if [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetSheHe] would be willing to help produce the book.
EVTOPTA106030: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] will see if this is agreeable
EVTDESC106031: A book on world history and you want me to help produce it? Rashid al-Din Hamadani, though your idea sound reasonable enough, why would you consider me to help you produce 'Jami' al-tawarikh' or 'Compendium of Chronicles'? I am interested though...
EVTOPTA106031: Let us see what we can do together...
EVTDESC106035: Ibn al-Nafis studied medicine, jurisprudence, literature and theology at Bimaristan Al-Noori in [Root.GetName]. His book 'Kitab al-Mukhtar fi al-Aghdhiya' on the effects of diet on health has been praised as one of the most important work on medicine in several years. The man is now looking for work, maybe as a physician at [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court.
EVTOPTA106035: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] would be pleased to have you as [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHis] physician
EVTDESC106036: I have never doubted that what you eat affects your health, but Ibn al-Nafis book 'Kitab al-Mukhtar fi al-Aghdhiya' made me realize how your health could deteriorate if you weren't too careful with what you ate or drank. I was therefore both grateful and honored when the physician Ibn al-Nafis asked me for a place in my court.
EVTOPTA106036: I would never refuse such a great physician anything!
EVTDESC106040: The book 'Kitab al-Mu'tabar' or 'The Book of What Has Been Established by Personal Reflection' by Abu'l-Barakat al-Baghdadi has recently been produced in [Root.GetName] and [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] is most curious of the man to write such an anti-Aristotelian philosophical work.
EVTOPTA106040: My liege wishes to talk to you, Abu'l-Barakat al-Baghdadi
EVTDESC106041: An extraordinary anti-Aristotelian philosophical work 'Kitab al-Mu'tabar' or 'The Book of What Has Been Established by Personal Reflection', but who is the man behind the book, this Abu'l-Barakat al-Baghdadi? After hours of discussing philosophy with Abu'l-Barakat al-Baghdadi I offered him a place at my court, to make sure he could continue writing his books.
EVTDESC106045: Avempace or Abu-Bakr Muhammad ibn Yahya ibn al-Sayigh, an astronomer, logician, musician, philosopher, physician, physicist, psychologist, botanist, poet and scientist in [Root.GetName] has caught [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] attention with his book 'Kitab al-Nabat' or 'The Book of Plants' and his other works.
EVTOPTA106045: Avempace, [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] would like to meet you
EVTDESC106046: 'Knowledge cannot be acquired by senses alone but by Active Intelligence, which is the governing intelligence of nature'\nA great quote from a great man, Avempace has been brought to my attention by his book 'Kitab al-Nabat' or 'The Book of Plants' and the essay 'Recognition of the Active Intelligence'. The man gladly accepted a place at my court.
EVTOPTA106046: Welcome, and don't hesitate to ask if you need anything at all
vassal_fatwa_decision_desc: [Root.GetTitledName] is known for the decadent ways of [Root.GetHerHis] dynasty. Convince your [From.GetLordSpiritualName] to issue a fatwa against [Root.GetHerHim]. This would make it easier to revoke titles and grant them to someone more deserving...
EVTTOOLTIP88750: You suggest someone deserving of a fatwa to your [From.GetLordSpiritualName].
EVTDESC106050: The poet Nizami Ganjavi from [Root.GetName] has completed his epic 'Khosrow and Shirin', a tragic love story. Even [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] has heard of the epic and has sent for Nizami Ganjavi...
EVTDESC106051: I offered my condolences to Nizami Ganjavi, whose wife died not long after he completed his epic 'Khosrow and Shirin', a tragic love story. The more I talked to the poet from [From.GetName], the more I wanted Nizami Ganjavi to stay at my court and entertain me with his poetry.
EVTDESC106055: 'Nafa'is al-funun fi ara'is al-uyun', a Persian encyclopedia on the classification of knowledge by Muhammad ibn Mahmud al-Amuli is widely-read in [Root.GetName]. The man wishes to speak with [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] and present to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHim] a copy of his book as a gift...
EVTOPTA106055: I don't think [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] would oppose such a gift
EVTDESC106056: I have heard of the scholar from [From.GetName] and his Persian encyclopedia on the classification of knowledge titled 'Nafa'is al-funun fi ara'is al-uyun', the man named Muhammad ibn Mahmud al-Amuli, and I had been wanting to read his book since I first heard of it. Muhammad ibn Mahmud al-Amuli came to my court to give me a copy of his book.
EVTOPTA106056: Thank you, that was most gracious of you!
EVTDESC106060: A man with many passions, Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Balkhi or Rumi believes passionately in the use of music, poetry and dance as a path for reaching Allah and the people of [Root.GetName] says of him: 'He is not a prophet  but surely, he has brought a scripture'.
EVTOPTA106060: This is a man [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] should meet!
EVTDESC106061: The book 'Matnawiye Ma'nawi' or 'Spiritual Couplets' is by some Sufis regarded as a Persian Qur'an and the author Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Balkhi or Rumi believes passionately in the use of music, poetry and dance as a path for reaching Allah. His words and teachings are intriguing and I wish to know more about Rumi and his philosophy.
EVTOPTA106061: Tell me more, teach me how to reach Allah through the divine arts!
EVTDESC106065: Baha-ud-Din Naqshband Bukhari from [Root.GetName], the founder and spiritual master of Naqshbandi, is requesting an audience with [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTOPTA106065: It must be important if he is requesting an audience with the [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitle]!
EVTDESC106066: The Sufi order Naqshbandi is well-known in [From.GetName] and its founder and spiritual Master Baha-ud-Din Naqshband Bukhari has come to discuss some important matters with me, possibly involving their eleven principal teachings, such as for example Remembrance, Restraint or Recollection.
EVTOPTA106066: And a most giving meeting it was
EVTDESC106070: The Persian philosopher Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi is the founder of Oriental Theosophy in [Root.GetName], whose Islamic Mysticism school draws upon Zoroastrian and Platonic ideas. [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] is more than interested to meet Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi and discuss his latest book 'Partaw Nama' or 'Treatise on Illumination'.
EVTDESC106071: The Islamic Mysticism school Oriental Theosophy founded by Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi, an Persian philosopher, draws upon Zoroastrian and Platonic ideas. Lately I have been struggling with some philosophical problems myself, but after talking to Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi and reading his 'Partaw Nama' or 'Treatise on Illumination' I feel as if my questions has been answered.
EVTOPTA106071: Stay and tell me more about the Oriental Theosophy
EVTDESC106075: Athir al-Din al-Abhari from [Root.GetName] has written many books about astronomy, mathematics and philosophy, among them are 'Kitab al-Hidayah' or 'Guide on Philosophy' and 'Risala fi al-hay'a' or 'Treatise on astronomy'.
EVTOPTA106075: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] has expressed an wish to meet him
EVTDESC106076: I have invited Athir al-Din al-Abhari from [Root.GetName], the author of 'Kitab al-Hidayah' or 'Guide on Philosophy' and 'Risala fi al-hay'a' or 'Treatise on astronomy', to come to my court so that I may have someone to discuss philosophy with.
EVTDESC106080: Nasir al-Din al-Tusi from [Root.GetName], famous for his book 'Al-Tadhkirah fi'ilm al-hay'ah' or 'A memoir on the science of astronomy', wants to convince [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] to construct an observatory for establishing accurate astronomical tables for better astrological predictions.
EVTOPTA106080: Go ahead, I believe you are able to convince [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHim]
EVTDESC106081: 'An observatory? What for? 'Establishing accurate astronomical tables for better astrological predictions', what does that even mean? I will have to think about it.'\nNasir al-Din al-Tusi from [From.GetName] famous for his book 'Al-Tadhkirah fi'ilm al-hay'ah' or 'A memoir on the science of astronomy' wants permission from me to build an observatory.
EVTOPTA106081: I will give you my permission, nothing more!
EVTDESC106085: Abu Merwan Abdal-Malik ibn Zuhr from [Root.GetName] has improved surgical and medical knowledge by keying out several diseases and their treatments. He has completed a book, 'Al-Taisir Fil-Mudawat Wal-Tadbeer' or 'Book of Simplification Concerning Therapeutics and Diet' which he wishes to present to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName].
EVTOPTA106085: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] will welcome Ibn Zuhr warmly to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHis] court
EVTDESC106086: 'Al-Taisir Fil-Mudawat Wal-Tadbeer' or 'Book of Simplification Concerning Therapeutics and Diet' was given to me by its author Abu Merwan Abdal-Malik ibn Zuhr with hopes of gaining my favor. The man is a renowned physician who improved surgical and medical knowledge by keying out several diseases and their treatments.
EVTDESC106090: Mir Sayyid Ali Hamadani has returned to [Root.GetName] after travelling far and wide. He is preaching Islam to the unbelievers and his book 'Dah Qaidah' which gives ten rules of contemplative life is one of the most widely known and read books at this time.
EVTOPTA106090: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] will greet Mir Sayyid Ali Hamadani warmly
EVTDESC106091: He has travelled for many years, undertaken Hajj thrice and written many treatises and tracts regarding religion, including the 'Dah Qaidah' which gives ten rules of contemplative life. Mir Sayyid Ali Hamadani is most welcome at my court.
EVTOPTA106091: Rest, my friend, and tell me of your travels
EVTDESC106095: Qutb al-Din al-Shirazi from [Root.GetName], a master chess player, player of the musical instrument Rabab and contributor to astronomy, mathematics, medicine, physics, music theory, philosophy and Sufism has an insatiable desire for learning and wishes to stay at [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] to be able to concentrate on some of his research.
EVTOPTA106095: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] would surely not deny this man a place at court!
EVTDESC106096: I have a fondness for the musical instrument Rabab and have been looking for someone to teach me how to play chess. I praised Allah when Qutb al-Din al-Shirazi, a master chess player, player of the Rabab and contributor to astronomy, mathematics, medicine, physics, music theory, philosophy and Sufism wishes to stay at my court to be able to concentrate on some of his research.
EVTOPTA106096: You may stay, if you teach me how to play chess
EVTDESC106100: Al-Dakhwar started his work as an oculist at the Nuri Hospital of [Root.GetName] and then continued studying medicine with Ibn al-Matran. His book 'al-Janinah' or 'The Embryo' and the poetry book 'Kitab ul-Aghani', a summarized version of 'The Book of Songs' by al-Isfahani, has made him famous beyond [Root.GetName].
EVTOPTA106100: The [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitle] couldn't wish for a better physician
EVTDESC106101: I offered Al-Dakhwar, the author of 'al-Janinah' or 'The Embryo', a former oculist at the Nuri Hospital of [From.GetName] and student of Ibn al-Matran, 30 dinars a month as my chief of medicine but he refused! He said: 'I know my ability in this field and I will not take less than 100 dinars a month!'
EVTOPTB106101: No, you will be satisfied with 30 dinars or nothing!
EVTDESC106105: An older man, Zayn al-Din, who was a pupil of Ibn Abi Sadiq and Ahmad ibn Farrokh, has arrived to [Root.GetName] and is asking for a place at [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court as court physician while working on his medical encyclopedia 'Thesaurus of the Shah of Khwarazm'. So far only five of ten volumes has been finished, on anatomy, physiology, hygiene, diagnosis and prognosis.
EVTOPTA106105: I doubt the [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitle] would want an old man as [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHis] court physician
EVTDESC106106: It was an impressive work, the incomplete medical encyclopedia 'Thesaurus of the Shah of Khwarazm', that Zayn al-Din presented to me. At first I was hesitant but the pupil of Ibn Abi Sadiq and Ahmad ibn Farrokh persisted, Zayn al-Din managed to convince me and I accepted him as my court physician.
EVTOPTA106106: Could you take a look at my tooth? It aches!
EVTDESC106110: A compilation of the beautiful sketches of flowers, plants and trees in different stages of their growth made by a professional painter employed by Rashidun al-Suri, a physician and botanist in [Root.GetName], is very popular at the moment.
EVTOPTA106110: This book and the man should be brought to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]'s attention
EVTDESC106111: The physician and botanist Rashidun al-Suri seemed embarrassed by all the compliments and praise his work had gotten, Rashidun al-Suri told us he just wanted sketches of flowers, plants and trees in different stages of their growth to be able to study them more thoroughly but the painter he had employed had compiled a collection of the sketches and started to sell them in [From.GetName].
EVTOPTA106111: Stay at my court as my physician, I wish to learn more about you and botany
EVTDESC106115: After many years of travelling, his visits included Bugia, Constantinople, Tunis and Barqa, Ibn al-Baitar has returned to [Root.GetName] with a large collection of plants. He has during his travels recorded the discoveries made by other physicians and added 300 to 400 new types of medicine to the one thousand previously known.
EVTOPTA106115: I am sure [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] would like to see your collection of plants
EVTDESC106116: Ibn al-Baitar has returned to [From.GetName] from his travels around the known world, visits to Bugia, Constantinople, Tunis and Barqa included, with a large collection of plants. His pharmacopoeia lists 1,400 plants, foods, and drugs. I may never find a more competent physician.
EVTOPTA106116: I wish for you to stay at my court as court physician and chief herbalist
EVTDESC106120: The epic poem 'Zafar-Nameh', 'The Book of Victory', by historian, poet and geographer Hamdallah Mustawfi tells the tale of Iranian history from the Arab conquest to the Mongols. It is finished but has yet to be published as Hamdallah Mustawfi lacks the funds necessary.
EVTOPTA106120: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] might be interested in your poem...
EVTDESC106121: History can be fascinating, but also incredible boring. The epic poem 'Zafar-Nameh', 'The Book of Victory', by Hamdallah Mustawfi telling the tale of Iranian history from the Arab conquest to the Mongols is never boring and I agreed to help Hamdallah Mustawfi publish it.
EVTOPTA106121: Stay at my court for as long as you wish
EVTDESC106125: The Sage of [Root.GetName], Khwaja Abdullah Ansari, has with his oratory and poetic talents in Arabic and Persian caught [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]'s attention. The man is a known traditionalist, polemicist, spiritual master and author of several books about mysticism and philosophy.
EVTDESC106126: Khwaja Abdullah Ansari is called the Sage of [From.GetName], and I do not doubt that a man with his oratory and poetic talents in Arabic and Persian would have no trouble living up to that reputation. His books about mysticism and philosophy shows his background as a traditionalist, polemicist and spiritual master.
EVTOPTA106126: A most curious and intriguing man
EVTDESC106130: Jamshid al-Kashi, an astronomer and mathematician from Kashan in [Root.GetName] wants an opportunity to contribute with his vast amounts of knowledge to [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetHerHis] subjects.
EVTOPTA106130: Serfs do not need knowledge, but the [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitle] do
EVTDESC106131: Jamshid al-Kashi brought with him the book 'Treatise on Astronomical Observational Instruments', describing different instruments, such as triquetrum and armillary sphere and the sine and versine instrument of Urdi. He only asked for an opportunity to teach me and the people, to contribute with his vast amounts of knowledge.
EVTOPTA106131: Sounds good. Now, how do you use a triquetrum and armillary sphere?
EVTDESC106135: The Sufi order Kubraviya in [Root.GetName] focuses on explaining the visionary experience and seeking the meaning of visions through ritual performances and meditation. The Kubraviya's founder Najmuddin Kubra discuss the analysis of dreams and visions in his works, something [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] finds interesting.
EVTOPTA106135: Najmuddin Kubra is invited to meet [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]
EVTDESC106136: The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, developed the Islamic faith based on dreams and visions so the Sufi order Kubraviya's focus on seeking the meaning of visions through ritual performances and meditation is most important. I invited the order's founder Najmuddin Kubra to learn more.
EVTOPTA106136: How may prayer and fasting help me connect to the divine in a spiritual way?
EVTDESC106140: 'Treatise on Demonstration of Problems of Algebra' by Omar Khayyám from [Root.GetName] lays down the principles of algebra and derives general methods for solving cubic equations and even some higher orders. A great mathematician like Omar Khayyám is something [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court is missing.
EVTDESC106141: [From.GetName] has produced a great mathematician, Omar Khayyám, whose work 'Treatise on Demonstration of Problems of Algebra' lays down the principles of algebra and derives general methods for solving cubic equations.
EVTDESC106145: The restless traveller Ibn Battuta from [Root.GetName] has returned home after another of his travels around the world, this time he visited Medina, then followed the river Tigris to Basra, Shiraz, Tabriz, Mosul, Cizre and Mardin. A traveller like him should have many tales to entertain [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] with.
EVTOPTA106145: Ask Ibn Battuta to tell his travel stories to the [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitle]
EVTDESC106146: Ibn Battuta is a renowned traveller, so when he returned home to [From.GetName] I invited him to tell me tales of his travels and I was not disappointed. Ambushes, bandits, famous mosques, beautiful cities and all sorts of adventures had Ibn Battuta seen and experienced.
EVTOPTA106146: Where will your next journey take you?
EVTDESC106150: Fakhr al-Din al-Razi's belief that proofs based on hadith 'could never lead to certainty but only to presumption, a key distinction in Islamic thought.' has divided the philosophers of [Root.GetName], some agrees with the theologian and others argues against his presumption.
EVTDESC106151: Furious philosophers and theologians in [From.GetName] are arguing against and for Fakhr al-Din al-Razi's belief that proofs based on hadith 'could never lead to certainty but only to presumption, a key distinction in Islamic thought.'. Fakhr al-Din al-Razi was called to account for his opinion and argued so well I found no flaws.
EVTOPTA106151: Tell me, would you like a place at court, as court philosopher?
EVTDESC106155: The poetry of Ibn al-Khatib has been put to music as Muwashshah but the man is more than a poet, he is also a writer, historian, philosopher and physician.
EVTDESC106156: I first read, then heard Ibn al-Khatib's poetry as it had been put to music as Muwashshah. A most prominent man from [From.GetName], besides writing poetry he is also a writer, historian, philosopher and physician.
EVTOPTA106156: Stay at my court and write more poetry!
EVTDESC106160: Ibn Rushd from [Root.GetName] is a versatile man, a master of philosophy, theology, logic, the science medicine, astronomy and many other subjects. Among his works we find his medical encyclopedia called 'Kulliyat' or 'Generalities' and 'Fasl al-Maqal', which argues for the legality of philosophical investigation under Islamic law.
EVTDESC106161: Every Qadi should read Ibn Rushd's 'Fasl al-Maqal' which argues for the legality of philosophical investigation under Islamic law. The man from [From.GetName] is a master of philosophy, theology, logic, the science medicine, astronomy and many other subjects, any court would pride itself in having Ibn Rushd as court philosopher.
EVTOPTA106161: Ask him to stay at my court as court philosopher
EVTDESC106165: Every university has Ibn Sina's 'The Canon of Medicine' as a standard medical text. Ibn Sina is from [Root.GetName] and his works includes writing on every possible subject, from philosophy to alchemy to geology to poetry and so on.
EVTOPTA106165: [Root.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] would be pleased to meet you
EVTDESC106166: I read Ibn Sina's 'The Canon of Medicine' as part of my education and found it fascinating. I tried to invite Ibn Sina to my court several times, but he had little time to waste. Then I offered him a job as court physician and now I can discuss philosophy, alchemy, geology, poetry or any other subject we both find fascinating.
EVTOPTA106166: Tell me your opinion on Aristotle's philosophy...
EVTDESC106170: Al-Jaldaki from [Root.GetName] is a brilliant alchemist whose 'al-Misbah fi Ilm al-Miftah' or 'Key of the Sciences of Lights' and 'The Proof Regarding Secrets of the Science of the Balance' or 'Kitab al-Burhan fi asrar 'ilm al-mizan' are widely acclaimed by other alchemists.
EVTOPTA106170: Why haven't we heard of him before?
EVTDESC106171: I had the fortune to meet the alchemist Al-Jaldaki from [From.GetName] and invited him to my court. His works 'al-Misbah fi Ilm al-Miftah' or 'Key of the Sciences of Lights' and 'The Proof Regarding Secrets of the Science of the Balance' or 'Kitab al-Burhan fi asrar 'ilm al-mizan' are brilliant.
EVTOPTA106171: I am lucky to have him here
EVTDESC88750: Your master, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName], has come forward in private with a suggestion that you, as [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] [Root.Liege.GetLordSpiritualName], issue a fatwa against [From.GetTitledName]. No doubt the [Root.Liege.GetTitle] has [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] own motives for this, but it cannot be denied that [From.GetFirstName] leads a decadent lifestyle with little room for piety.
EVTOPTA88750: Very well, the fatwa shall be issued.
EVTOPTB88750: No, their squabbling does not concern me.
EVTDESC88751:
Esteemed [Root.GetTitle], I have taken your suggestion into consideration, and after much thought I have arrived at the same conclusion as you. A fatwa will be issued.

Your faithful servant,
[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC88752: Your decadent ways and lack of devotion to Allah (glorified and exalted be He) can no longer be tolerated. After consulting with my master, [From.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], I have reached the conclusion that a fatwa must be issued against you. May you return to the path of righteousness before it is too late.\n\n[From.GetTitledName]
EVTDESC88753: My [Root.GetTitle], I must object to this shameful attempt on your part to invoke the will of Allah (glorified and exalted be He) in your petty feud. There will be no fatwa that you can take advantage of to further your own ambitions.\n\n[From.GetTitledName]
EVTOPTA88753: You will come to regret this.
EVTDESC88754: You put forward the name of [From.GetTitledName] to your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName], with the not so subtle suggestion that [From.GetSheHe] may be deserving of a fatwa.
EVTOPTA88754: For the sake of our children, if nothing else.
EVTTOOLTIP88753: Informed fatwa will not be issued.
EVTDESC89015: Though you are the first wife of [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName], his current announced heir is not a child of yours. Perhaps you could talk to your husband and persuade him to grant your son more land, thus increasing his power and influence...
EVTTOOLTIP89016: You tell your boy about your plans.
EVTDESC89016: Your dear mother, [Root.Mother.GetTitledFirstName], is very upset that despite her position as your father's first wife, his announced heir is not a child of hers. Today she has announced her intentions to plead with your father to grant you more land, thus increasing the influence of her favored little boy... you.
EVTDESC89017: Your dear first wife, [From.Mother.GetFirstName], has once again cornered you and is expressing her shame and embarrassment over the fact that your current heir is not a child of hers. She is pleading with you to grant more land to her precious boy [From.GetFirstName], increasing his influence.
EVTOPTA89017: Fine, fine. If it will get you off my back...
EVTOPTB89017: No, I do not care who his mother is. He has not earned it.
EVTDESC89018: Despite your mother's arguments, your father has refused to grant you more land for now. In fact, he seems a bit disappointed that you would let your mother fight your battles for you...
EVTOPTA89018: But... but... I didn't tell her to...!
EVTDESC89020: You have toiled long and hard for your husband, [Root.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName], and even gifted him with a son. But the heir is not a child of yours, and as soon as [Root.Spouse.Heir.GetFirstName] assumes the throne, your son may be killed as a pretender. Perhaps it would be best to strike first...
EVTOPTA89020: I do this for my son!
EVTDESC89021: Auntie [From.GetFirstName], one of your father's wives, gives you a cup of tea and insists you drink it. The tea smells funny, though, and you refuse to taste it. When [From.GetFirstName] tries to force you to drink, the tea spills on the floor and is lapped up by one of your pet cats... who promptly dies.
EVTDESC89022: One of your wives, [From.GetFirstName], has been caught trying to serve a cup of poisoned tea to [Root.Heir.GetFirstName], your son and heir. Only your son's keen senses revealed the beverage for the vile poison it was before he drank from the cup. It seems her goal was to make her own son your heir...
EVTOPTA89022: You would kill my own son? This will cost you dearly.
EVTOPTC89022: Oh well. Just don't do it again.
EVTDESC89023: Auntie [From.GetFirstName], one of your father's wives, gives you a cup of tea and insists you drink it. The tea tastes funny, though, and when you have emptied the cup, the world fades away...
EVTDESC89024: Your son and heir, [Root.Heir.GetFirstName], has mysteriously perished after becoming suddenly ill. Though you and your advisors suspect foul play, you have no idea where to place the blame...
EVTDESC89025: Your son and heir, [Root.Heir.GetFirstName], has perished after being served a cup of poisoned tea by [From.GetFirstName], your treacherous wife! It seems she murdered him in an effort to see her own son declared as heir.
EVTOPTA89025: My son... you will suffer a thousand deaths for this, woman.
EVTOPTB89025: Throw the wench into the dungeons!
EVTOPTC89025: Oh well. What is done is done.
EVTDESC88300: [From.GetTitledName] has decided to hold a great Furusiyya martial competition, and has sent invitations out to warriors across the land. As [From.GetSheHe] is of the same house as you, this initiative has reduced the decadence of your entire dynasty in the eyes of the people.
EVTDESC88301: [From.GetTitledName] has been declared as the winner of a great Furusiyya martial competition! This triumph reflects well on how decadent the people see your entire dynasty, as you are of the same house.
EVTDESC88302: [From.GetTitledName] has been declared the second champion of a great Furusiyya martial competition! This accomplishment has reduced the decadence of your entire dynasty in the eyes of the people, as you and [From.GetFirstName] are of the same house.
EVTDESC88303: [From.GetTitledName] has won third place in a great Furusiyya martial competition! People now view your whole dynasty as slightly less decadence, as you and [From.GetFirstName] are of the same house.
